intro: Eleocharis torticulmis, commonly known as the twisted spike rush, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are often slightly curved, giving it its common name. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Eleocharis torticulmis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
